metadata.Title: CVE-2016-9951 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in Apport before 2.20.4. A malicious Apport crashfile can contain a restart command in `RespawnCommand` or `ProcCmdline`fields. This command will be executed if a user clicks the Relaunch buttonon the Apport prompt from the malicious crash file. The fix is to only showthe Relaunch button on Apport crash files generated by local systems. TheRelaunch button will be hidden when crash files are opened directly inApport-GTK.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9951` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

apport - 2.20.1-0ubuntu2.4
apport-gtk - 2.20.1-0ubuntu2.4
apport-kde - 2.20.1-0ubuntu2.4
apport-noui - 2.20.1-0ubuntu2.4
apport-retrace - 2.20.1-0ubuntu2.4
apport-valgrind - 2.20.1-0ubuntu2.4
dh-apport - 2.20.1-0ubuntu2.4
python-apport - 2.20.1-0ubuntu2.4
python-problem-report - 2.20.1-0ubuntu2.4
python3-apport - 2.20.1-0ubuntu2.4
python3-problem-report - 2.20.1-0ubuntu2.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: apport package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.20.1-0ubuntu2.4').
